page.title: 01North Weald Bassett
page.content: North Weald Bassett parish covers 4.042 acres.The village is surrounded by farmland used for growing crops and the rearing of animals. On the eastern boundary is the old airfield which is mainly used for storage or weekend events such as airshows.The radio station is run by British Telecom but will soon be "moth balled" for emergency use only.There are nurseries growing salad crops and a fish farm.There is a development of light industrial units manufacturing fencing,gates and stairs as well as storing equipment.Most North Weald people work in surrounding towns although some use the underground railway and travel into London.The village is growing and two large new estates are being built which has necessitated the building of a new sewage works in Church Lane.
